events.title: The Acts of Union 1707 Takes Effect
events.description: The Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland merge to form the Kingdom of Great Britain.
events.significance: This event marks the unification of England and Scotland under one government, which profoundly influenced the political landscape of the British Isles.

events.title: Haymarket Affair in Chicago
events.description: A peaceful rally in support of workers striking for an eight-hour workday turns violent after a bomb is thrown at police.
events.significance: The Haymarket Affair becomes a key moment in labor history, inspiring May 1st as International Workers' Day, symbolizing the fight for workers' rights worldwide.

events.title: Empire State Building Opens in New York City
events.description: The Empire State Building, the tallest building in the world at the time, officially opens to the public.
events.significance: A symbol of American innovation and economic strength, the building quickly becomes an architectural icon.

events.title: Expansion of the European Union
events.description: Ten new countries join the European Union in the largest single expansion of the EU to date.
events.significance: This expansion strengthens European integration and reshapes political and economic relations across the continent.
